p: Several compositional and structural plant cell walls’ features are recognised as factors impacting saccharification independent of biomass species and pretreatment [ 6]. Lignin content, composition and structure strongly limit biomass deconstruction both by restricting the access to the polysaccharides and by non-productively binding enzymes [ 12, 13]. Lignin removal from the plant cell wall is likely to increase its global porosity, which also influences enzymes’ diffusion and is possibly directly correlated with biomass initial digestibility [ 14]. These factors influence cellulose accessible surface area which is also an important parameter as it governs enzymes binding to substrate [ 15, 16].
